alert.note: Alert for Collin; Dallas; Rockwall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 7:41AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Rockwall, southeastern Collin and northeastern Dallas Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 741 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sachse, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This includes Interstate 30 between mile markers 62 and 79. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Lake Lavon, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
